title: US, India Keep Door Open to Trade Talks
description: On the early edition of Balance of Power, Bloomberg Correspondents Joe Mathieu and Kriti Gupta discuss the latest news from Washington. On today's show, Stonecourt Capital Partner Rick Davis, Harvard Kennedy School's Ash Center Democracy Visiting Fellow Jeanne Sheehan Zaino and former Acting White House Chief of Staff Mick Mulvaney.  (Source: Bloomberg)
content: > > LIVE FROM WASHINGTON, D.C., THIS IS "BALANCE OF POWER" WITH JOE MATHIEU AND KAILEY LEINZ. JOE: UNCERTAINTY RETURNS, IF IT EVER WENT AWAY. YEAH, YOU CAN CALL IT A REDRAWING OF THE GLOBAL MAP. shortSummary: The US and India are keeping their doors open for trade talks amid uncertainty over the Trump TARIFF Regime's future, with potential shutdowns looming.
argos_summary: Bloomberg’s "Balance of Power" highlighted a court ruling declaring most of President Trump’s tariff regime illegal, sparking market uncertainty and a sharp decline in equity indices and a rally in gold and oil.  The segment also discussed the administration’s push for a government shutdown, the deployment of National Guard troops in cities like Chicago, and the broader geopolitical shift as China, India, Russia, and the U.S. navigate trade and security tensions.  Analysts warned that the legal challenges to tariffs and fiscal policy could reshape U.S. trade strategy and domestic politics in the coming weeks.
